Can you solve this language puzzle? Decode the errors in this sentence using the table below:
"Theater play, that I watched yesterday, wasn't what I had anticipated; it was really not good."
| Error Type | Incorrect | Correct | Explanation |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Grammar | I watched | I saw | Incorrect verb tense |
| Punctuation | Theater play, that I watched yesterday, wasn't what I had anticipated; it was really not good. | Theater play that I watched yesterday wasn't what I had anticipated. It was really not good. | Unnecessary commas and incomplete sentence |
| Grammar | It was really not good. | It was not good. | Incorrect word choice |
Put your language skills to the test and fix the sentence accordingly.

Certainly! Based on the corrections provided in the table, here's the revised sentence:

"Theater play that I saw yesterday wasn't what I had anticipated. It was not good."
